2. Tracing techniques: Methods used to track the movement of a substance, such as a dye, through the body. In this case, the tracing techniques are used to identify the pathway of the bladder afferent cells.
3. Bladder afferent cells: Specialized nerve cells that transmit information from the bladder to the brain. These cells are located in the lumbosacral DRG.
4. Lumbosacral DRG (Dorsal Root Ganglion): A cluster of nerve cells located in the lower back, near the spine. The lumbosacral DRG is responsible for processing sensory information from the bladder and other parts of the lower urinary tract.
